name: cede
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to allow someone else to have or own something, especially unwillingly or because you are forced to do so: Hong Kong was ceded to Britain after the Opium War.

Add to word list
Add to word list
to give control or possession of something, esp. land to someone else, often unwillingly or because forced to do so: New Orleans was ceded to Spain in 1763.
Add to word list
Add to word list
to give something such as control, power, or a right to someone else, especially unwillingly: She says that she is finally learning to delegate, though she's still reluctant to cede control.cede sth to sb The United States has already ceded its dominance of mass production manufacturing to low-wage countries.
